I only intend reform to the best of my ability. My success comes only through Allah. In Him I trust and to Him I turn

translations.1: Wa-yaa-qawmi laa yajri-mannakum shiqaaqeee aien yuseebakum mislu maaa asaaba qawma Noohin aw qawma Hoodin aw qawma Saalih; Wa-maa qawmu Lootim minkum biba'eed
translations.15: O my people! Do not let your opposition to me lead you to a fate similar to that of the people of Noah, or Hûd, or Ṣâliḥ. And the people of Lot are not far from you

words.translation: And ask forgiveness|(of) your Lord|then|turn in repentance|to Him|Indeed|my Lord|(is) Most Merciful|Most Loving

translations.1: Wastaghfiroo Rabbakum summa toobooo ilaih; inna Rabbee Raheemunw Wadood
translations.15: So seek your Lord’s forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. Surely my Lord is Most Merciful, All-Loving.”

words.translation: They said|O Shuaib|Not|we understand|much|of what|you say|and indeed, we|surely [we] see you|among us|weak|And if not|for your family|surely we would have stoned you|and you are not|and you are not|against us|mighty

translations.1: Qaaloo yaa-Shu'aibu maa nafqahu kaseeram mimmaa taqoolu Wa-innaa lanaraaka feenaa da'eefanw Wa-law-laa rahtuka larajamnaaka Wa-maaa anta 'alainaa bi'azeez
translations.15: They threatened, “O Shu’aib! We do not comprehend much of what you say, and surely we see you powerless among us. Were it not for your clan, we would have certainly stoned you, for you are nothing to us.”

words.translation: He said|O my people!|Is my family|mightier|on you|than|Allah|And you have taken Him|behind your|backs|Indeed|my Lord|of what|you do|(is) All-Encompassing

translations.1: Qaala yaa-qawmi arahteee a'azzu 'alaikum minal laahi wattakhaztumoohu waraaa'akum zihriyyan inna Rabbee bimaa ta'maloona muheet
translations.15: He said, “O my people! Do you have more regard for my clan than for Allah, turning your back on Him entirely? Surely my Lord is Fully Aware of what you do

words.translation: And O my people!|Work|(according) to|your position|indeed I am|working|Soon|you will know|(on) whom|will come|a punishment|(that will) disgrace him|and who|[he]|(is) a liar|And watch|indeed I am|with you|a watcher

translations.1: Wa-yaa-qawmi' maloo 'alaa makaanatikum innee 'aamilun sawfa ta'lamoona many ya'teehi 'azaabuny yukhzeehi Wa-man huwa kaazib; wartaqibooo innnee ma'akum raqeeb
translations.15: O my people! Persist in your ways, for I ˹too˺ will persist in mine. You will soon come to know who will be visited by a humiliating torment and is a liar! And watch! I too am watching with you!”

words.translation: And when|came|Our Command|We saved|Shuaib|and those who|believed|with him|by a Mercy|from Us|And seized|those who|wronged|the thunderous blast|then they became|in|their homes|fallen prone

translations.1: Wa-lammaa jaaa'a amrunaa najjainaa shu'aibanw wal-lazeena aamanoo ma'ahoo birahmatim minnaa Wa-akhazatil lazeena zalamus saihatu fa-asbahoo fee diyaarihim jaasimeen
translations.15: When Our command came, We saved Shu’aib and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us. And the ˹mighty˺ blast overtook the wrongdoers, so they fell lifeless in their homes

words.translation: As if|not|they (had) prospered|therein|So|away|with Madyan|as|was taken away|the Thamud

translations.1: Ka-al lam yaghnaw feehaaa; alaa bu'dal li-Madyana Kamaa ba'idat Samood
translations.15: as if they had never lived there. So away with Midian as it was with Thamûd

words.translation: And certainly|We sent|Musa|with Our Signs|and an authority|clear

translations.1: Wa-laqad arsalnaa Moosaa bi-Aayaatinaa Wa-sultaanim mubeen
translations.15: Indeed, We sent Moses with Our signs and compelling proof

words.translation: To|Firaun|and his chiefs|but they followed|(the) command|Firaun|and not|(the) command|Firaun|was right

translations.1: Ilaa Fir'awna Wa-mala'ihee fattaba'ooo amra Fir'awna Wa-maaa amru Fir'awna birasheed
translations.15: to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and Pharaoh’s command was not well guided

words.translation: He will precede|his people|(on the) Day|(of) the Resurrection|and lead them|(into) the Fire|And wretched|(is) the place|to which (they are) led

translations.1: Yaqdumu qawmahoo Yawmal Qiyaamati fa-awrada-humun Naara Wa-bi'sal wirdul mawrood
translations.15: He will be before his people on the Day of Judgment and will lead them into the Fire. What an evil place to be led into

words.translation: And they were followed|in|this|(by) a curse|and (on the) Day|(of) the Resurrection|Wretched|(is) the gift|which (will) be given

translations.1: Wa-utbi'oo fee haazihee la'natanw Wa-Yawmal Qiyaamah; bi'sar rifdul marfood
translations.15: They were followed by a curse in this ˹life˺ and ˹will receive another˺ on the Day of Judgment. What an evil gift to receive

words.translation: That|(is) from|(the) news|(of) the cities|(which) We relate|to you|of them|some are standing|and (some) mown

translations.1: Zaalika min ambaaa'il quraa naqussuhoo 'alaika minhaa qaaa'imunw Wa-haseed
translations.15: These are accounts, We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺, of the ˹destroyed˺ cities. Some are still standing ˹barren˺, while others have been mowed down

words.translation: And not|We wronged them|but|they wronged|themselves|So not|availed|them|their gods|which|they invoked|other than Allah|other than Allah|other than Allah|any|thing|when|came|(the) command (of)|your Lord|And not|they increased them|other than|ruin

translations.1: Wa-maa zalamnaahum Wa-laakin zalamooo anfusahum famaaa aghnat 'anhum aalihatuhumul latee yad'oona min doonil laahi min shai'il lammaa jaaa'a amru Rabbika Wa-maa zaadoohum ghaira tatbeeb
translations.15: We did not wrong them, rather they wronged themselves. The gods they invoked beside Allah were of no help at all when the command of your Lord came, and only contributed to their ruin

words.translation: And thus|(is) the seizure (of)|your Lord|when|He seizes|the cities|while they|(are) doing wrong|Indeed|His seizure|(is) painful|(and) severe

translations.1: Wa-kazaalika akhzu Rabbika izaaa akhazal quraa Wa-hiya zaalimah; inna akhzahooo aleemun shadeed
translations.15: Such is the ˹crushing˺ grip of your Lord when He seizes the societies entrenched in wrongdoing. Indeed, His grip is ˹terribly˺ painful and severe

words.translation: Indeed|in|that|(is) surely a Sign|for (those) who|fear|(the) punishment|(of) the Hereafter|That|(is) a Day|(will) be gathered|on it|the mankind|and that|(is) a Day|witnessed

translations.1: Inna fee zaalika la-aayatal liman khaafa 'azaabal Aakhirah; zaalika Yawmum majmoo'ul lahun naasu Wa-zaalika Yawmum mashhood
translations.15: Surely in this is a sign for those who fear the torment of the Hereafter. That is a Day for which humanity will be gathered and a Day ˹that will be˺ witnessed ˹by all˺

words.translation: And not|We delay it|except|for a term|limited

translations.1: Wa-maa nu'akhkhiruhooo illaa li-ajalim ma'dood
translations.15: We only delay it for a fixed term

words.translation: (The) Day|(it) comes|not|will speak|a soul|except|by His leave|Then among them|(will be the) wretched|and (the) glad

translations.1: Yawma yaati laa takallamu nafsun illaa bi-iznih; faminhum shaqiyyunw Wa-sa'eed
translations.15: When that Day arrives, no one will dare speak except with His permission. Some of them will be miserable, others joyful

words.translation: As for|those who|were wretched|then (they will be) in|the Fire|For them|therein|(is) sighing|and wailing

translations.1: Fa-ammal lazeena shaqoo fafin Naari lahum feehaa zafeerunw Wa-shaheeq
translations.15: As for those bound for misery, they will be in the Fire, where they will be sighing and gasping

words.translation: (Will be) abiding|therein|as long as remain|as long as remain|the heavens|and the earth|except|what|wills|your Lord|Indeed|your Lord|(is) All-Accomplisher|of what|He intends

translations.1: Khaalideena feehaa maa daamatis samaawaatu wal-ardu illaa maa shaaa'a Rabbuk; inna Rabbaka fa'-'aalul limaa yureed
translations.15: staying there forever, as long as the heavens and the earth will endure, except what your Lord wills. Surely your Lord does what He intends

words.translation: And as for|those who|were glad|then (they will be) in|Paradise|(will be) abiding|therein|as long as remains|as long as remains|the heavens|and the earth|except|what|wills|your Lord|a bestowal|not|interrupted

translations.1: Wa-ammal lazeena su'idoo fafil Jannati khaalideena feehaa maa daamatis samaawaatu wal-ardu illaa maa shaaa'a Rabbuk; ataaa'an ghaira majzooz
translations.15: And as for those destined to joy, they will be in Paradise, staying there forever, as long as the heavens and the earth will endure, except what your Lord wills—a ˹generous˺ giving, without end

words.translation: So (do) not|be|in|doubt|as to what|worship|these (polytheists)|Not|they worship|except|as what|worshipped|their forefathers|before|before|And indeed, We|will surely pay them in full|their share|without|being diminished

translations.1: Falaa taku fee miryatim mimmmaa ya'budu haaa'ulaaa'; maa ya'budoona illaa kamaa ya'budu aabaaa'uhum min qabl; Wa-innaa lamuwaf-foohum naseebahum ghaira manqoos
translations.15: So do not be in doubt ˹O Prophet˺ about what those ˹pagans˺ worship. They worship nothing except what their forefathers worshipped before ˹them˺. And We will certainly give them their share ˹of punishment˺ in full, without any reduction

words.translation: And verily|We gave|Musa|the Book|but differences arose|therein|And if not|(for) a Word|(that) preceded|from|your Lord|surely would have been judged|between them|And indeed they|surely (are) in|doubt|concerning it|suspicious

translations.1: Wa-laqad aatainaa Moosal Kitaaba fakhtulifa feeh; Wa-law-laa Kalimatun sabaqat mir Rabbika laqudiya bainahum; Wa-innahum lafee shakkim minhu mureeb
translations.15: Indeed, We had given Moses the Scripture, but differences arose regarding it. Had it not been for a prior decree from your Lord, their differences would have been settled ˹at once˺. They are truly in alarming doubt about it

words.translation: And indeed|to each [when]|to each [when]|surely will pay them in full|your Lord|their deeds|Indeed, He|of what|they do|(is) All-Aware

translations.1: Wa-inna kullal lammaa la-yuwaffiyannahum Rabbuka a'maalahum; innahoo bimaa ya'maloona Khabeer
translations.15: And surely your Lord will fully pay all for their deeds. He is certainly All-Aware of what they do

words.translation: So stand firm|as|you are commanded|and (those) who|turn (in repentance)|with you|and (do) not|transgress|Indeed He|of what|you do|(is) All-Seer

translations.1: Fastaqim kamaaa umirta Wa-man taaba ma'aka Wa-laa tatghaw; innahoo bimaa ta'maloona Baseer
translations.15: So be steadfast as you are commanded ˹O Prophet˺, along with those who turn ˹in submission to Allah˺ with you. And do not transgress. Surely He is All-Seeing of what you ˹believers˺ do

words.translation: And (do) not|incline|to|those who|do wrong|lest touches you|the Fire|and not|(is) for you|besides Allah|besides Allah|besides Allah|any|protectors|then|not|you will be helped

translations.1: Wa-laa tarkanooo ilal lazeena zalamoo fatamassa-kumun Naaru Wa-maa lakum min doonil laahi min awliyaaa'a summa laa tunsaroon
translations.15: And do not be inclined to the wrongdoers or you will be touched by the Fire. For then you would have no protectors other than Allah, nor would you be helped

words.translation: And establish|the prayer|(at the) two ends|(of) the day|and (at) the approach|of|the night|Indeed|the good deeds|remove|the evil deeds|That|(is) a reminder|for those who remember

translations.1: Wa-aqimis Salaata tarafayin nahaari Wa-zulafam minal layl; innal hasanaati yuzhibnas saiyi-aat; zaalika zikraa liz-zaakireen
translations.15: Establish prayer ˹O Prophet˺ at both ends of the day and in the early part of the night. Surely good deeds wipe out evil deeds. That is a reminder for the mindful

words.translation: And be patient|for indeed|Allah|(does) not|let go waste|(the) reward|(of) the good-doers

translations.1: Wasbir fa-innal laaha laa yudee'u ajral muhsineen
translations.15: And be patient! Certainly Allah does not discount the reward of the good-doers

words.translation: So why not|had been|of|the generations|before you|before you|those possessing a remnant|those possessing a remnant|forbidding|from|the corruption|in|the earth|except|a few|of those|We saved|among them|But followed|those who|did wrong|what|luxury they were given|therein|and they were|criminals

translations.1: Falaw-laa kaana minal qurooni min qablikum ooloo baqiyyatiny yanhawna 'anil fasaadi fil ardi illaa qaleelam mimman anjainaa minhum; wattaba'al lazeena zalamoo maaa utrifoo feehi Wa-kaanoo mujrimeen
translations.15: If only there had been among the ˹destroyed˺ peoples before you, ˹O believers,˺ virtuous individuals who forbade corruption in the land—other than the few We had saved ˹from the torment˺. But the wrongdoers ˹only˺ pursued their ˹worldly˺ pleasures, becoming wicked

words.translation: And not|would|your Lord|destroy|the cities|unjustly|while its people|(were) reformers

translations.1: Wa-maa kaana Rabbuka liyuhlikal quraa bizulminw Wa-ahluhaa muslihoon
translations.15: And your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ would never destroy a society unjustly while its people were acting rightly

words.translation: And if|your Lord (had) willed|your Lord (had) willed|surely He (could) have made|the mankind|one community|one community|but not|they will cease|to differ

translations.1: Wa-law shaaa'a Rabbuka laja'al annnaasa ummatanw waa-hidatanw Wa-laa yazaaloona mukhtalifeen
translations.15: Had your Lord so willed, He would have certainly made humanity one single community ˹of believers˺, but they will always ˹choose to˺ differ—

words.translation: Except|(on) whom|your Lord has bestowed Mercy|your Lord has bestowed Mercy|and for that|He created them|And will be fulfilled|(the) Word of your Lord|(the) Word of your Lord|Surely I will fill|Hell|with|the Jinn|and the men|all together

translations.1: Illaa mar rahima Rabbuk; Wa-lizaalika khalaqahum; Wa-tammat Kalimatu Rabbika la-amla'ana Jahannama minal jinnati wannnaasi ajma'een
translations.15: except those shown mercy by your Lord—and so He created them ˹to choose freely˺. And so the Word of your Lord will be fulfilled: “I will surely fill up Hell with jinn and humans all together.”

words.translation: And each|We relate|to you|of|(the) news|(of) the Messengers|(for) that|We may make firm|with it|your heart|And has come to you|in|this|the truth|and an admonition|and a reminder|for the believers

translations.1: Wa-kullan naqussu 'alaika min ambaaa'ir Rusuli maa nusabbitu bihee fu'aadak; Wa-jaaa'aka fee haazihil haqqu Wa-maw'izatunw Wa-zikraa lilmu'-mineen
translations.15: And We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ the stories of the messengers to reassure your heart. And there has come to you in this ˹sûrah˺ the truth, a warning ˹to the disbelievers˺, and a reminder to the believers

words.translation: And say|to those who|(do) not|believe|Work|(according) to|your position|indeed we|(are also) working

translations.1: Wa-qul lillazeena laa yu'minoo na'maloo 'alaa makaanatikum innaa 'aamiloon
translations.15: Say to those who disbelieve, “Persist in your ways; we will certainly persist in ours

words.translation: And wait|indeed we|(are) ones who wait

translations.1: Wantaziroo innaa mun-taziroon
translations.15: And wait! Surely we ˹too˺ are waiting.”

words.translation: And for Allah|(is the) unseen|(of) the heavens|and the earth|and to Him|will be returned|the matter|all (of) it|so worship Him|and put your trust|upon Him|And your Lord is not|And your Lord is not|unaware|of what|you do

translations.1: Wa-lillaahi ghaibus samaawaati wal-ardi Wa-ilaihi yurja'ul amru kulluhoo fa'bud-hu Wa-tawakkal 'alaih; Wa-maa Rabbuka bighaafilin 'ammaa ta'maloon
translations.15: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the knowledge of what is hidden in the heavens and the earth. And to Him all matters are returned. So worship Him and put your trust in Him. And your Lord is never unaware of what you do
